questionListItems.title: How do I apply for a free Lasting Power of Attorney and Advance Care Planning (LPA-ACP) mobile clinic session?

answer.body:
Thank you for your interest in the Lasting Power of Attorney - Advance Care Planning (LPA-ACP) Mobile Clinics. The mobile clinics are open to only Singaporeans aged 50 years and above with a valid CHAS Blue/Orange card. 

If you meet our eligibility criteria and would like to register for our upcoming mobile clinics, you can visit our website - https://www.giftofcertainty.gov.sg/events/. We will open the appointment slots for the mobile clinics for booking about 3 weeks before the event. There will be a "Book a Slot" button at the bottom of the event page once booking slots are open. Kindly note that all bookings can only be made through our website.

 

If you do not meet the eligibility criteria above or wish to complete your LPA and ACP sooner, you can do so by contacting an LPA Certificate Issuer and ACP Facilitator. You can refer to this page - https://mylegacy.life.gov.sg/find-a-service/ to find a service provider. Do check with your preferred service provider on their charges and availability before heading down. 

 

For ACP, if you are receiving medical care at a public healthcare institution, you can ask your care team to arrange an ACP session for you. If you are not receiving treatment at any public healthcare institution, you can contact a community ACP facilitator using the link above.

questionListItems.title: I have signed up for the free Lasting Power of Attorney and Advance Care Planning (LPA-ACP) mobile clinic session, what do I need to prepare?

answer.body:
Please bring along your NRIC and CHAS Blue or Orange card for identification purposes.


For LPA, please complete your LPA form and ensure all your Donee(s) and Replacement Donee (if any) have accepted their appointment. You should have received an SMS/email notification to visit the certificate issuer. Your LPA status should be “Pending Certification”. Your Donees do not have to be present on that day, unless they are your Nominated Healthcare Spokespersons for the ACP.


For ACP, please prepare for the session by reflecting on the values and preferences that are important to you using an ACP Booklet or the LPA-ACP Tool on My Legacy (https://mylegacy.life.gov.sg/find-a-service/lpa-acp/). Your Nominated Healthcare Spokesperson(s) will have to be present for the session.

questionListItems.title: What if I’m not eligible for a free Lasting Power of Attorney and Advance Care Planning (LPA-ACP) mobile clinic session? How do I get my LPA/ACP done?

answer.body:
You can still complete your LPA and ACP by booking an appointment with an LPA Certificate Issuer (CI) or ACP facilitator near you.


You can visit https://mylegacy.life.gov.sg/find-a-service to find an LPA Certificate Issuer and ACP facilitator. You are advised to check with your preferred service provider on the charges and availability before heading down.


For the ACP, if you are receiving medical care at a public healthcare institution, you can ask your care team to arrange an ACP session for you. If you are not receiving treatment at any public healthcare institution, you can contact a community ACP facilitator.

questionListItems.title: Where can I view my Lasting Power of Attorney?

answer.body: If your Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) has been registered, a copy of it will be available for viewing in the Office of Public Guardian Online (OPGO) (https://opg-eservice.msf.gov.sg/OPGO/Home.aspx). If you are unable to view your LPA on OPGO, please contact the Office of Public Guardian at 1800 111 2222 or email them at enquiry@publicguardian.gov.sg

questionListItems.title: How much do Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) Certificate Issuers charge for their services?

answer.body:
As of July 2023, the fees range of the 20 most visited Certificate Issuers (CI) across the three groups of professionals for LPA Form 1 certification are as follows:

 

  • Accredited doctors: $25 to $70

  • Lawyers: $50 to $500

  • Psychiatrists: $154 to $600 

Do note that the fees stated above exclude consultation and GST. For a more accurate reflection on the charge you may incur, we advise that you enquire the total expected cost directly from your preferred CI.

 

You may refer to https://opg-eservice.msf.gov.sg/LPA/CIMapService.aspx to look for a CI. Do contact your preferred CI to check their availability before heading down.

questionListItems.title: Where can I find my Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) form?

answer.body: You will be able to access your Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) application at the Office of the Public Guardian Online (OPGO) - MSF after you login with your Singpass. The Certificate Issuer is also able to access the application after he keys in your personal details (i.e. NRIC and name) in the system.

questionListItems.title: How do I download my Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) draft?

answer.body: You may access and retrieve the electronic copy of your LPA application from Office of the Public Guardian Online (OPGO) - MSF. Login via Singpass and click ‘LPA No.’ on your Overview page.

questionListItems.title: Can I submit a hardcopy Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) application?

answer.body:
From 14 November 2022, all LPA applications must be submitted online by default. If you're uncomfortable with technology and need help completing your LPA application online, visit a CitizenConnect Centre or ServiceSG centre (list on OPG website) or contact the Office of the Public Guardian (OPG) hotline at 1800 111 2222. OPG may accept hardcopy LPA applications if you fall within one of the following exceptional situations, subject to the Public Guardian’s approval:

  • you or your Donees (including Replacement Donee) are unable to complete the application online due to physical disability or other circumstances

  • when both the prepare your LPA service on My Legacy and the Office of the Public Guardian (OPGO) are down

  • you do not have an electronic device to receive SMSes or create and access the Singpass account

  • you or your Donees (including Replacement Donee) are not eligible for a Singpass account


If one of these situations describes yours, you may submit a hardcopy LPA application. Download and print the LPA Form from OPG website, complete it, have it certified by a certificate issuer and mail in or drop it off to the Office of the Public Guardian (OPG) at 20 Lengkok Bahru #04-02, Family@Enabling Village, Singapore 159053. Please include a cover letter to explain why you’re submitting a hardcopy application instead of an online application.

questionListItems.title: How do I bring ashes back to Singapore from overseas?

answer.body:
If you wish to bring human ashes back to Singapore, you will have to:

  • place the ashes in a covered urn or container during travel (choose a non-metallic urn so that they can be x-rayed during security screenings).

  • make sure that a copy of the death certificate and cremation certificate (both in English) are accompanying the urn during travel. You will need to get an English translation of these documents if they are issued in another language. Translations from private organizations are accepted.

  • contact the airline to find out whether you can carry the ashes as hand luggage or as checked-in luggage.


There is no requirement for a permit to bring human ashes back to Singapore. However, each country has its own rules about departing with human ashes and there may be additional requirements. questionListItems.title: How can the next of kin submit the digital death certificate to HDB and banks if they are requesting an "original" hardcopy?

answer.body: For deaths that occur after 29 May 2022, only digital death certificates will be issued. You can provide the digital death certificate to HDB/banks who require you to submit the death certificate. Agencies who receive digital death certificates from NOK can verify these death certificates by scanning the QR code printed at the bottom right of the digital death certificates or visit https://go.gov.sg/ica-verify-edc.

questionListItems.title: How do I obtain more information on my deceased next-of-kin's bank accounts?

answer.body:
We would like to clarify that unclaimed monies in bank accounts will continue to be held by the banks even when the accounts are inactive or if the account holder has passed on. As the banks are required to comply with customer information confidentiality requirements under the Banking Act, the banks are unable to disclose details pertaining to the bank account(s) held by the deceased without the appropriate court documents such as the Grant of Probate (if the deceased made a will) or Grant of Letters of Administration (if the deceased did not make a will).


You can check the Family Justice Courts website (https://www.judiciary.gov.sg/family/apply-for-letters-of-administration) or enquire with the Family Justice Courts for more information on the court procedure.

questionListItems.title: What is the process for a funeral service company to be included in the list of providers?

answer.body:
With an aim to provide a comprehensive and trustworthy resource for those seeking funeral services, we have worked with NEA to curate the list of companies in our site.


Currently, only companies who are members of the Association of Funeral Directors are listed to ensure that the companies listed meet certain standards of professionalism and service. Companies that wish to be listed in our site will have to be a member of the association.


For non-members, we will take into consideration when we next review My Legacy website.

questionListItems.title: Can the social service practitioners, social workers, social service volunteers, and/or funeral directors download the digital death certificate for a deceased person with no next-of-kin (e.g. single elderly)?

answer.body:
For deceased with no immediate Next-of-Kin, social workers or Funeral Directors assisting in the post-death matters can approach the hospital or certifying doctor for a hardcopy printout of the death certificate. 

Only Next-of-Kin of the deceased or persons authorised by the Next-of-Kin are allowed to download a copy of the digital death certificate from My Legacy. The Next-of-Kin for this purpose are: spouse, parent, child, sibling, grandparent, grandchild, aunt/uncle and niece/nephew.

questionListItems.title: Do we still need to return the deceased's NRIC to the police?

answer.body: There is no longer a need to surrender the deceased’s NRIC in police station for physical invalidation. To prevent it from being misused, you can either destroy the NRIC or punch a hole in it.

questionListItems.title: How do I check if deceased has made a will?

answer.body: You can refer to https://mylegacy.life.gov.sg/when-death-happens/wills-and-inheritance/ for more information.
